alert.note: Alert for Newport (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 9:44PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Barnstable, southern Plymouth, southeastern Bristol and northeastern Newport Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 944 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Freetown, or near New Bedford, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... New Bedford, Fall River, Plymouth, Taunton, Dartmouth, Marion, Middleborough, Wareham, Sandwich, Bourne, Somerset, Fairhaven, Swansea, Tiverton, Westport, Kingston, Carver, Lakeville, Acushnet, and Freetown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
